TypeSignature.Value: public delegate void DataTableNewRowEventHandler(object sender, DataTableNewRowEventArgs e);
.class public auto ansi sealed DataTableNewRowEventHandler extends System.MulticastDelegate
Public Delegate Sub DataTableNewRowEventHandler(sender As Object, e As DataTableNewRowEventArgs)
public delegate void DataTableNewRowEventHandler(System::Object ^ sender, DataTableNewRowEventArgs ^ e);
type DataTableNewRowEventHandler = delegate of obj * DataTableNewRowEventArgs -> unit

Docs.param: A that contains the event data.
Docs.summary: Represents the method that handles the method.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When you create a <xref:System.Data.DataTableNewRowEventHandler> delegate, you identify the method that will handle the event. To associate the event with your event handler, add an instance of the delegate to the event. The event handler is called whenever the event occurs until you remove the delegate. For more information about delegates, see [Handling and Raising Events](~/docs/standard/events/index.md).
